How to Install hamradio-training on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • hamradio-training

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install hamradio-training on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing hamradio-training on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall hamradio-training in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install hamradio-training, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install hamradio-training Using apt

To install hamradio-training in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install hamradio-training using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install hamradio-training

The installation of hamradio-training might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install hamradio-training Using apt-get

To install hamradio-training using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install hamradio-training.

sudo apt-get -y install hamradio-training

Install hamradio-training Using Synaptic

To install hamradio-training using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install hamradio-training on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for hamradio-training. This will display the hamradio-training package in the package window, now to install hamradio-training, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the hamradio-training package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of hamradio-training.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install hamradio-training Using aptitude

To install hamradio-training on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of hamradio-training.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install hamradio-training using the command aptitude install hamradio-training.

sudo aptitude -y install hamradio-training

How to Upgrade hamradio-training on debian

If you want to upgrade the hamradio-training package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade hamradio-training using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade hamradio-training to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade hamradio-training.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade hamradio-training sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade hamradio-training

Upgrade hamradio-training using Aptitude

To upgrade hamradio-training using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade hamradio-training.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade hamradio-training

Upgrade hamradio-training using Synaptic

To upgrade hamradio-training using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for hamradio-training, now right-click hamradio-training, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade hamradio-training just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall hamradio-training on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall hamradio-training from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just hamradio-training, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove hamradio-training

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of hamradio-training

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of hamradio-training you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge hamradio-training

Remove hamradio-training using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall hamradio-training using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for hamradio-training, right-click the hamradio-training package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall hamradio-training click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install hamradio-training on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade hamradio-training using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of hamradio-training then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
